arm_group.description: Healthy family members of patients with inherited platelet disorders

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this study is to identify the platelet defect responsible for the bleeding in
      families from our inherited platelet disorders Israeli-Palestinian  registry. The
      investigators plan to characterize platelet proteome expression after removing high
      abundance proteins. The investigators will compare the proteome of sick and healthy members
      of families with inherited platelet disorders, and identify and validate structural
      proteins, signaling cascades and biomarkers for detection and diagnosis of unknown platelet
      disorders. The investigators expect to discover new key findings that allow better
      understanding of human platelet function and allow better diagnosis and treatment of
      patients with inherited platelet function disorders.

clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Proteomics for the Diagnosis of a Platelet-related Bleeding Disorder

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  History of inherited platelet disorders in the family

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

intervention.intervention_name: Blood collection for platelet protein samples

clinical_study.official_title: Use of Proteomics for the Diagnosis of a Platelet-related Bleeding Disorder

other_outcome.description: Identify and validate a panel of specific biomarkers candidates
other_outcome.measure: Number of proteins that inducate disease

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of platelet proteome of sick and healthy members of families with inherited platelet disorders
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in protein expression from sick and healthy platelets

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
